summary: This document is a chain of emails from October-November 2020 between Diane Aldrich (executive assistant to attorney Gloria Allred) and an individual named Angela, discussing travel arrangements for a client of Allred's to attend a meeting in Miami related to Epstein victims. The emails clarify the client's legal name versus her stage name and mention the client's boyfriend joining for support.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Serves as the primary correspondent in the email chain, facilitating communication about a client's travel to a Miami meeting for Epstein victims.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Named as the attorney whose firm represents clients who are Epstein victims; her assistant is coordinating travel for a client to a meeting.

persons.name: Angela
persons.context: The recipient/initiator of several emails, asking for confirmation about invites for Epstein victims represented by Gloria Allred and assisting with travel arrangements for a Miami meeting.

persons.name: Dal
persons.context: Mentioned by Angela as someone who is asking for confirmation about whether Gloria Allred and her clients received invites.

connections.description: Diane Aldrich is identified as the Executive Assistant to attorney Gloria Allred.
Gloria Allred represents a client who is an Epstein victim and wishes to attend a Miami meeting.
Angela mentions that 'Dal is asking me' for confirmation about the invites, indicating a working or reporting relationship.
The client wishes to have her boyfriend join her for support at the Miami meeting.

events.title: Initial Email Regarding DOJ Invites
events.description: Angela emails Diane Aldrich to confirm if Gloria Allred's office received invites for the clients (Epstein victims) that Gloria represents.

events.title: Request for Client Attendance at Miami Meeting
events.description: Diane Aldrich emails Angela to request that their client (an Epstein victim) and the client's boyfriend be able to attend a meeting in Miami, with travel arrangements to be made.

events.title: Clarification of Client's Name
events.description: Diane Aldrich clarifies that the client's legal last name differs from her stage name (as an actor), and that her travel ID is under her legal name.

keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred's firm was representing clients who were victims of Jeffrey Epstein as of late 2020.
A meeting was being organized in Miami for Epstein victims, requiring travel arrangements and invitation confirmations.
One of Allred's clients, who is also an actor using a stage name, wished to attend the Miami meeting with her boyfriend for support.
The email chain highlights ongoing legal and support coordination for Epstein victims several years after Epstein's death.
